global.name: Name
global.nameRule: Only letters, numbers, - and _ are supported, and can only begin with letters
global.descriptionPlaceholder: Please enter the description for this route, max 256 characters
global.popconfirmDelete: Are you sure to delete this record ?

route.description: Route is the entry point of a request, which defines the matching rules between a client request and a service. A route can be associated with a service (Service), an upstream (Upstream), a service can correspond to a set of routes, and a route can correspond to an upstream object (a set of backend service nodes), so each request matching to a route will be proxied by the gateway to the route-bound upstream service.

path.required: Please enter a valid HTTP request path
path.placeholder: Please enter the HTTP request path
path.label: Path

ssl.description: The certificate is used by the gateway to process encrypted requests, which will be associated with the SNI and bound to the host name in the Route.

cert.label: Certificate Content
cert.minLength: The Certificate Content requires at least 128 characters

key.label: Private Key
key.minLength: The Private Key requires at least 128 characters

upstream.description: The upstream list contains the created upstream services (i.e., backend services) and allows load balancing and health checking of multiple target nodes of the upstream services.

service.description: A service consists of a combination of public plugin configuration and upstream target information in a route. Services are associated with Routes and Upstreams, and a service can correspond to a set of upstream nodes and can be bound by multiple routes.

consumer.description: Consumers are the consumers of Routes, e.g developers, end users, API calls, etc.

proto.description: Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral, extensible mechanism for serializing structured data.You define how you want your data to be structured once, then you can use special generated source code to easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data streams and using a variety of languages.The protocol buffers list contains the created proto files. When the grpc transcode plug-in is enabled, the ID can be configured to read the contents of the corresponding proto files.

serverInfo.title: System Info
serverInfo.selectPlaceholder: Please select a apache apisix node
serverInfo.description: The relevant plugin needs to be enabled to report server info.

grafanaURL.label: Grafana Address
grafanaURL.help: Grafana address should begin with HTTP or HTTPS

plugin.tip1: NOTE: After customizing the plugin, you need to update schema.json.

passHost.pass: Keep the same Host from client request
passHost.node: Use the domain or IP from Node List
passHost.rewrite: Custom Host (Will be deprecated in the future)
